means: 策（马）前进( spur的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The encouragement of a friend spurred Chris into switching jobs.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一位朋友的鼓励下，克理斯换了工作。

sentence.Network_en: Sabres rasped from scabbards and the horsemen spurred forward.
sentence.Network_cn: 马刀在刀鞘里咔嗒作响，骑手催马向前。

sentence.Network_en: What spurred them on was alchemy, the'science " of changing ordinary metals into gold.
sentence.Network_cn: 激励他们的是炼金术, 即把普通金属变为金子的 “ 科学 ”.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词汇新译 S_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... spurn 弃绝 spurred 有马刺的 spurrey 大爪草属.
Environmental concerns have spurred dramatic improvements in the way waste is managed in many countries ., 在许多国家人们对环境的关注已经促使废品的处理方式产生了极大的改进.
《Friends》词汇表B ... Po n. 波河 spurred adj. 装有马刺的 concession n. 让步.
He spurred on through the mud ., 他驱马穿过了泥沼.

true velocity 真速度truncated spur 截切山嘴truncation 辖

entry.def: If one thing spurs you to do another, it encourages you to do it.

example.ex: It's the money that spurs these fishermen to risk a long ocean journey in their flimsy boats...
example.tran: 是金钱驱使这些渔民驾着破旧小船冒险出海远航。

example.ex: His friend's  plight had spurred him into taking part.
example.tran: 朋友的困境促使他投身参与。

entry.def: If something spurs a change or event, it makes it happen faster or sooner.

example.ex: The administration may put more emphasis on spurring economic growth...
example.tran: 政府可能会更加重视推动经济增长。

example.ex: The trade pacts will spur an exodus of US businesses to Mexico.
example.tran: 这些贸易协定将会促使大批美国企业涌向墨西哥。

entry.def: Something that acts as a spur to something else encourages a person or organization to do that thing or makes it happen more quickly.

example.ex: ...a belief in competition as a spur to efficiency...
example.tran: 认为竞争会促进效率的信念

example.ex: Redundancy is the spur for many to embark on new careers.
example.tran: 裁员促使很多人开始从事新事业。

entry.def: Spurs are small metal wheels with sharp points that are attached to the heels of a rider's boots. The rider uses them to make their horse go faster.
The spur of a hill or mountain is a piece of ground which sticks out from its side.
If you do something on the spur of the moment, you do it suddenly, without planning it beforehand.

example.ex: They admitted they had taken a vehicle on the spur of the moment...
example.tran: 他们承认是一时冲动偷走了一辆车。

example.ex: It wasn't a spur-of-the-moment decision. We discussed it in detail beforehand.
example.tran: 这可不是头脑一热作出的决定。我们事先仔细地讨论过。

entry.def: If you win your spurs or earn your spurs, you achieve a particular status by proving that you can do something skilfully.

example.ex: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
example.tran: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。

auth_sentence.content: I think losing the first game spurred us on.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think losing the first game spurred us on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think losing the first game spurred us on.

auth_sentence.content: The experience spurred him to push for protection laws.
auth_sentence.res_content: The experience spurred him to push for protection laws.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The experience spurred him to push for protection laws.

auth_sentence.content: Growth has been spurred by both supply and demand.
auth_sentence.res_content: Growth has been spurred by both supply and demand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Growth has been spurred by both supply and demand.
